definitions.definition: (usually with on) To repeatedly mention a subject.
definitions.example: Why do you harp on a single small mistake?

definitions.definition: To play on (a harp or similar instrument)
To play (a tune) on the harp.
To develop or give expression to by skill and art; to sound forth as from a harp; to hit upon.
The dull thud of something landing on a surface.
A large sum of money.
A dollar.
To drop or throw something heavily onto or into something else, so that it makes a dull sound.
definitions.example: Enrique plunked his money down on the counter with a sigh and bellied up to the bar.

definitions.definition: To land suddenly or heavily; to plump down.
To intentionally hit the batter with a pitch.
definitions.example: The Braves retaliated by plunking Harper in the next inning.

definitions.definition: (of a raven) To croak.
To pluck and quickly release (a musical string).
To be a truant from (school).
The quality or state of being inflexible, or not capable of being bent or changed; unyielding stiffness
The person conducting a role-playing game, generally responsible for controlling all beings and processes other than the players.
To run a roleplaying game; to act as a gamemaster
Kerosene.
A type of wooden drinking vessel produced by the Incas.
To rapidly grow out of proportion or control.
definitions.example: The high unemployment rates quickly snowballed into a major budget problem for the government.

definitions.definition: To play at throwing snowballs.
To pelt with snowballs; to throw snowballs at.
(sexual slang) To receive a man's ejaculate in one's mouth, and then to pass it back and forth between one's mouth and his.
An athletics event in which contestants compete in swimming, cycling and running in turn.
A former Olympic athletics event in which contestants compete in long jump, shot put, and 100-yard dash.
Generally, a sports event in which contestant compete in a combination of three sports.
A tract of scrubland habitats characterised by open, low growing woody vegetation, found on mainly infertile acidic soils. Similar to moorland but with warmer and drier climate.
To post to a weblog by this means.
Characterized by or having the form of a grid or network.
Constructed with diamond-shaped stones.
Having a reticle in the focus of an eyepiece.
definitions.example: a reticulated micrometer

definitions.definition: With a crook or bend; with the hand on the hip and elbow turned outward.
Into, in, or of the position where the arms are akimbo.
definitions.example: The man was standing akimbo.

definitions.definition: A tree of the genus Fagus having a smooth, light grey trunk, oval, pointed leaves and many branches.
The wood of the beech tree.
Of, pertaining to, or in the nature of a revelation
Prophetic (especially of doom); apocalyptic
A fish, the twaite shad, Alosa fallax
Motherboard
To learn.
To teach.
definitions.example: Larn yersel te taalk propa like!

definitions.definition: A plucked stringed instrument with five or seven steel strings stretched on a long fretted finger-board over two gourds, used mostly in Carnatic Indian classical music.
Someone who receives a gift from a donor.
definitions.example: John became the donee of the bone marrow donated by his brother.

definitions.definition: To break into large pieces or chunks.
To break down (language, etc.) into conceptual pieces of manageable size.
To throw.
The process of reducing something to short, thick pieces, usually using a hammer or a crowbar.
A strategy for making more efficient use of short-term memory by recoding information.

(writing) A method of presenting information which splits concepts into small pieces or "chunks" of information to make reading and understanding faster and easier, using such methods as bulleted lists, short subheadings, or short sentences with one or two ideas per sentence.
The division of memory or data etc. into smaller units for easier processing.
The partial-quotients method for solving simple division problems by repeated subtraction.
Extremely thin; of utmost thinness
The condition of being particular; attention to detail; fastidiousness
A particular thing; a peculiarity
(chiefly in the plural) a writing system of ancient Egypt, Minoans, Maya and other civilizations, using pictorial symbols to represent individual sounds as a rebus
Any symbol used in this system; a hieroglyph
(by extension) undecipherable handwriting or secret symbol
Of, relating to, or written with this system of symbols
definitions.example: hieroglyphic obelisk

definitions.definition: Difficult to decipher
The use of a probe containing liquid nitrogen to freeze and thus destroy tissue.
(heading) To send someone away and forbid that person from returning.
To expel, especially from the mind.
definitions.example: banish fear, qualm.

definitions.definition: A magical ritual intended to remove negative spiritual influences.
One billion hertz, 109 Hz.
A person whose prevailing mental imagery takes the form of inner feelings of action, such as incipient pronunciation of words, muscular innervations, etc.
Having the power to move spontaneously.
Producing motion.
definitions.example: motile powers

definitions.definition: Of or relating to those mental images that arise from the sensations of bodily movement and position.
A plagioclase feldspar mineral, calcium sodium aluminum silicate, often very coarsely crystalline, used as a decorative stone for carvings and building façades.
Of, or having, a single legislative chamber.
Of a script or typeface: making no distinction between upper and lower case, but rather having only one case.
The atomic nucleus of a deuterium atom, consisting of a proton and a neutron
Marshy land; bog or fen
A swirling vortex.
A circular current, especially a large-scale ocean current.
A circular motion, or a circle described by a moving body; a turn or revolution; a circuit.
To whirl
Any of several straight muscles in various parts of the body, as of the abdomen, thigh, eye etc.
Any specific living organism.
A great outcry or vociferation; loud and continued shouting or exclamation.
Any loud and continued noise.
A continued public expression, often of dissatisfaction or discontent; a popular outcry.
To cry out and/or demand.
definitions.example: Anyone who tastes our food seems to clamor for more.

definitions.definition: To demand by outcry.
definitions.example: Thousands of demonstrators clamoring the government's resignation were literally deafening, yet their cries fell in deaf ears

definitions.definition: To become noisy insistently.
definitions.example: After a confused murmur the audience soon clamored

definitions.definition: To influence by outcry.
definitions.example: His many supporters successfully clamor his election without a formal vote

definitions.definition: To silence.
To salute loudly.
To stun with noise.
To repeat the strokes quickly on (bells) so as to produce a loud clang.
A nightcap (hat worn to bed).
A linen or muslin hat, especially one of a type once commonly worn by elderly women and young children.
In Ancient Greece, a walkway with a roof supported by colonnades, often with a wall on one side; specifically, the Great Hall in Athens.
To give new life, energy, activity or success to something.
definitions.example: Japanese investment has revitalised this part of Britain!

definitions.definition: To rouse from a state of inactivity or quiescence.

A chronic, progressive, fatal central nervous system disease found mainly among the Fore and neighboring peoples of New Guinea, caused by a prion that probably resembles the scrapie agent of sheep, transmissible to nonhuman primates, and believed to be transmitted by ritual cannibalism.
A BMW motorcycle.
Exaggerated or caricatured, in the manner of a cartoon
definitions.example: She was grinning a big, cartoonish grin.

definitions.definition: To use, and pass off as one's own, someone else's writing, speech, ideas, or other intellectual or creative work, especially in an academic context; to commit plagiarism.
A flake
A lock, as of wool.
A small spot or streak; a speckle.
To mark with small spots
A long piece cut or rent off; a sharp, slender fragment; a splinter.
A strand, or slender roll, of cotton or other fiber in a loose, untwisted state, produced by a carding machine and ready for the roving or slubbing which precedes spinning.
Bait made of pieces of small fish. Compare kibblings.
A narrow high-rise apartment building.
To cut or divide into long, thin pieces, or into very small pieces; to cut or rend lengthwise; to slit.
definitions.example: to sliver wood

definitions.definition: (of a woman) Having large breasts; busty.
(of a cough or cold) Not dry; involving the coughing of phlegm.
definitions.example: a chesty cough; a chesty cold

definitions.definition: Coming from, or associated with, the chest.
definitions.example: a deep chesty voice

definitions.definition: Any plant of the genus Antirrhinum, with showy yellow, white or red flowers.
A game in which raisins are snatched from a vessel containing burning brandy, and eaten; the substance snatched and eaten during the playing of the game; the vessel used for the game.
To separate the threads (of); disentangle.
definitions.example: Mother couldn't unravel the ball of wool after the cat had played with it.

definitions.definition: (of threads, etc.) To become separated; (of something woven, knitted, etc.) to come apart.
To clear from complication or difficulty; to unfold; to solve.
definitions.example: to unravel a mystery

definitions.definition: To separate the connected or united parts of; to throw into disorder; to confuse.
definitions.example: to unravel the broad consensus which was created

definitions.definition: To become undone; to collapse.
A solid dielectric having a quasi-permanent charge; usually a metallized film; used in electroacoustic and electromechanical transducers and in air filters.
A sudden repressive or punitive restriction or control
A clasp or clip for gathering and holding the hair.
The lower part of the epimeron.
The preparing of a medicine, food or other substance out of many ingredients.
A mixture prepared in such a way.
Something made up, an invention.
Digestion (of food etc.).
The act of digesting in the mind; rumination.
Abatement of a morbid process, such as fever, and return to a normal condition.
The act of perfecting or maturing.
To clean the area between the teeth using floss.
To show off, especially by exhibiting one's wealth or talent.
To perform the floss dance move.
The act of removing food and plaque from one's teeth using dental floss.
definitions.example: The dentist advised regular flossings.

definitions.definition: The use of a weighted hook that pierces the fish's mouth from the outside.
The performance of the floss dance move.
A large membrane-bound vesicle in a cell's cytoplasm.
Of or pertaining to ghouls.
Of or pertaining to corpses and graverobbing.
Fascinated by corpses.
To add a feature or embellishment that makes something uglier; uglify.
To remove the adornments from.
Having no additional decoration or embellishment; plain and simple
A device that picks up snow off the ground and blows it to one side in order to clear a path or road.
The stage during which a program is executing.
The amount of time during which a program is executing.
A software component designed to support the execution of computer programs.
definitions.example: You need to install the .NET runtime before you can run this application.

definitions.definition: The length of a film, television program or audio track in minutes, usually with end credits included
A small Indian horse or pony.
To introduce or make a comment before (the main point).
definitions.example: Let me preface this by saying that I don't know him that well.

definitions.definition: To give a preface to.
definitions.example: to preface a book

definitions.definition: The quality or state of being arbitrary.
